uk.ac.forthvalley.examples

Class GridManager<tkn>

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.forthvalley.examples.GridManager<tkn>
  • Type Parameters:
    tkn - Passes in game token

    public class GridManager<tkn>
extends java.lang.Object
    Manage a grid of sprites, keeping track of locations and collisions, and updating sprites accordingly. The sprites live in a square grid of fixed size.
    Author:
    Natalie Gardner And andreas.schoter

      • incrementLevelCount

      • getLevelNo

        public int getLevelNo()
        Returns the current level number

      • addSprite

        public GameToken addSprite(java.awt.Point p,
                           tkn t)
        Add a new sprite at a physical location. The physical location must be converted to a logical location in the grid.
        Parameters:
        p - the physical location for the new sprite.
        t - the game token
        Returns:
        the new sprite, or null if the sprite could not be added.

      • setCurrent

        public void setCurrent(GameToken d)
        Make the given label the currently active sprite, updating icon images as necessary.
        Parameters:
        d - game token dolphin (warehouse keeper)

      • moveSprite

        public void moveSprite(Direction d)
        Move the currently active sprite (always dolphin) in the requested direction (up/down/left/right. If the sprite is at a grid boundary, it will not move past the given boundary This sets up the game rules involving collisions with all game tokens
        Parameters:
        d - the direction to move.
        p - the starting position
        q - the end position

      • checkDiamonds

        public boolean checkDiamonds()
        This checks if all crates are on diamonds
        Returns:
        returns true if level is complete

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This resets the level
